verbLexeme: 1. To have the right, chance, or duty to do something, when other people have done it before you or will do it after you, especially in a game. English = (be) one's turn.
nominalLexeme: 1. The time or opportunity to do something after other people have done it or before others will do it, especially as part of a game. English = turn.
oldEntry: Popular explanation: turning something, like a page, over.
